chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel D Moreno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office in a payment plan of $25.00 per month beginning 9/1/2016, and due on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.
$371.54 Restitution to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  No surcharge.  Bond to be applied with remaining balance of bond to be applied towards fine/costs.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office and is included in the payment plan of $25.00 per month beginning 9/1/2016, and due on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.
Defendant can request expunction, but must be current on payment plan.
